articles.title: Tonga eruption on a par with Krakatoa, study says - Daily Mail
articles.description: Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai, an underwater volcano in the South Pacific, created sound waves heard as far as Alaska 6,200 miles away when it erupted on January 15, a study says.
articles.content:
Tonga's volcanic eruption in January produced the strongest recorded waves from a volcano since the eruption of Krakatoa in 1883, scientists say.

articles.author: Antony Ashkenaz
articles.title: Antarctica breakthrough: Ice sheets have GROWN over last 20 years despite climate change - Express
articles.description: A NEW study has found that despite climate change causing global temperatures to rise, some ice sheets in Antarctica have actually grown over the past two decades.
